Description:

Ravi at Princeton University - Why I'm Not an Atheist:

Ravi Zacharias and Vince Vitale spoke an overflow crowd at Princeton University with the faculty and students titled, "Why I'm Not An Atheist."  The auditorium was filled to capacity and several students remarked that the event was the Ã¢â‚¬ËœbuzzÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ in many conversations on campus all week.

Warmly and thoughtfully, Dr. Zacharias presented his reasons as to why he thought Atheism was not a viable belief or foundation to base a world view on.  He presented many valid, logical answers supporting his view while respecting the opposing viewpoint, with sincerity and confidence.

Highlighting one particular question and the answer given by Vince Vitale, a Princeton Graduate and member of Ravi ZachariasÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ International Ministry staff.  A student from Ukraine, asked this:
"If the essence of God is to create and realize the infinte potential for creation, and He desires His children to capitulate His nature and continue His work, would not the act of creation itaself become and act of vanity?"

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The Great Debate with Dr. Hovind vs Dr. Michael Shermer - Creationism vs evolution:
Subtitled: Biblical Creation, Theistic Evolution, Evolution
April 25th, 2003 Dr. Hovind takes on Kyle Frazier and Dr. Michael Shermer at Emmanuel Christian Center, Minneapolis, MN.

In this debate Kent Hovind defends the position that the Bible is literally true, the earth is six thousand years old and the evolution theory is retarded. Kyle Frazier maintains the position that the earth is billions of years old, but God created it. This is commonly called the Theistic Evolution Position or the Progressive Creation Position. Michael Shermer, editor of Skeptic Magazine and author of How to Debate a Creationist, maintains the position that there is no God necessary and evolution can explain everything.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Evidence vs. Faith - Creation Today Season 3 Episode 8:
Evidence or faith? Upon which are your beliefs and your witness based? Paul and Eric discuss what people say, and what the Bible says, about these two terms. Gain understanding of real evidence and real faith to boldly and effectively witness to others!
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

DEBATE Phil Donahue, Duane Gish, Evolution vs. Creation:
This debate took place on Bob Hoskins' TV show called FEED BACK. Creation Life Publishers had a connection with the Institute for Creation Research (ICR), and Dr. John Morris, ICR President, gave me permission on April 5, 2013 to upload this video.


Towards the end of this debate, it becomes evident that the entire battle of evolution vs creationism is simply one of religion vs religion and not about the sciences. Unfortunately that is not what is taught in school. Under pretense of science, they actually teach evolution as a counter religion and this program sheds a minor light onto that topic. People need to realize religion, no matter which kind - e.g. christianity or evolution, should not be taught as science. For real science, not fake or disproved, is only what students should learn in science coursses. Religion falls into religious or philosophical ciriculum.

Does God Exist? A debate with William Lane Craig vs Peter Millican:
At Birmingham University, October 2011. This debate on "Does God Exist?" took place in front of a capacity audience at the Great Hall, University of Birmingham. It was recorded on Friday 21st October 2011 as part of the UK Reasonable Faith Tour with William Lane Craig.  Although there are many problems in the evolutionist rebuttals, Dr. Craig only focuses on a few and lets the others apprarantly slide by (at least for this debate).

William Lane Craig is Research Professor of Philosophy at Talbot School of Theology, La Mirada, California and a leading philosopher of religion.  Peter Millican is Gilbert Ryle Professor of Philosophy at Hertford College, University of Oxford and a noted scholar in studies of Hume.  The debate was hosted by the University of Birmingham Student Philosophy Society, and the debate was moderated by Professor Carl Chinn.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Hugh Ross vs Kent Hovind - How Old Is The Earth?
Hugh Ross presents and defends a biblical basis for believing that the earth is billions (not thousands) of years old. Speaking for the young-earth (YEC) position is Kent Hovind.
